intro: Sciadotenia pachnococca, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Its leaves are opposite and usually oval in shape, with a rough texture. Sciadotenia pachnococca is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
